pullRequest.body:
In this PR, it is shown that the category of sheaves `Sheaf J A` is a localization of the category `Presheaf J A` with respect to the class `J.W` of morphisms of presheaves which become isomorphisms after applying the sheafification functor.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Also is `W` standard nomenclature?

> I think the whole file holds for general reflective categories? We might not need this generality though.

Thanks for the review. I have shown the general localization lemma for an adjunction for which the right adjoint is fully faithful, but here I was able to define the class of morphisms `W` and some properties without even assuming that the adjoint exists! (In the applications, we shall use two different left adjoints to the forget functor from sheaves to presheaves, the abstract one given by `HasWeakSheafify`, and the one given by the plus-plus-construction.) Then, having a specialized API seems worth to me.

I have used `W` because it is the letter I have used throughout the localization of categories API. It appears it is used as well in https://ncatlab.org/nlab/show/category+of+sheaves

Ah so I guess it stands for weak equivalences
For general fully-faithful embeddings, I think
```
fun _ P₂ f => ∀ Q, Function.Bijective (fun (g : P₂ ⟶ F.obj Q) => f ≫ g)
```
works?
I think your definition works more generally. In order to avoid duplication of code, I think the most important is that I first develop classes of morphisms with the 2-out-of-3 property...

Indeed, your suggestion is very much related to definitions in the context of left Bousfield localization of model categories. I have included very basic API for left Bousfield localization, and deduced that sheafification is a localization.

@erdOne If you are happy with this, please go ahead and merge it.

bors d=erdOne

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks! LGTM
Feel free to merge if you are happy with the PR (This is still awaiting-author so I did not merge it).

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

I think the whole file holds for general reflective categories? We might not need this generality though.

Anyways LGTM modulo the minor comment.
Small nitpick. Otherwise LGTM.

```suggestion
/-!
# The sheaf category as a localized category

```

```suggestion
/-- Given a predicate `P : C → Prop`, this is the class of morphisms `f : X ⟶ Y`
```
This is abusing the `Set` defeq. Maybe `(· ∈ Set.range F.obj)` instead?

Also is `W` standard nomenclature?

Thanks for the review. I have shown the general localization lemma for an adjunction for which the right adjoint is fully faithful, but here I was able to define the class of morphisms `W` and some properties without even assuming that the adjoint exists! (In the applications, we shall use two different left adjoints to the forget functor from sheaves to presheaves, the abstract one given by `HasWeakSheafify`, and the one given by the plus-plus-construction.) Then, having a specialized API seems worth to me.

I have used `W` because it is the letter I have used throughout the localization of categories API. It appears it is used as well in https://ncatlab.org/nlab/show/category+of+sheaves

For general fully-faithful embeddings, I think
